get.summary: Get a filtered list of Event

parameters.name: studyDbId
parameters.description: List of study identifiers to search for

parameters.name: studyName
parameters.description: List of study names to filter search results

parameters.name: observationUnitDbId
parameters.description: The ID which uniquely identifies an observation unit.

parameters.name: eventDbId
parameters.description: Filter based on an Event DbId.

parameters.name: eventType
parameters.description: Filter based on an Event Type

parameters.name: dateRangeStart
parameters.description: Filter based on an Event start date.

parameters.name: dateRangeEnd
parameters.description: Filter based on an Event start date.

get.summary: Get a filtered list of Image

parameters.name: commonCropName
parameters.description:
The BrAPI Common Crop Name is the simple, generalized, widely accepted name of the organism being researched. It is most often used in multi-crop systems where digital resources need to be divided at a high level. Things like 'Maize', 'Wheat', and 'Rice' are examples of common crop names.

Use this parameter to only return results associated with the given crops. 

Use `GET /commoncropnames` to find the list of available crops on a server.

parameters.name: programDbId
parameters.description:
A BrAPI Program represents the high level organization or group who is responsible for conducting trials and studies. Things like Breeding Programs and Funded Projects are considered BrAPI Programs. 

Use this parameter to only return results associated with the given programs. 

Use `GET /programs` to find the list of available programs on a server.

parameters.name: programName
parameters.description:
Use this parameter to only return results associated with the given program names. Program names are not required to be unique.

Use `GET /programs` to find the list of available programs on a server.

parameters.name: descriptiveOntologyTerm
parameters.description: A list of terms to formally describe the image to search for. Each item could be a simple Tag, an Ontology reference Id, or a full ontology URL.

parameters.name: imageFileName
parameters.description: Image file names to search for.

parameters.name: imageFileSizeMax
parameters.description: A maximum image file size to search for.

parameters.name: imageFileSizeMin
parameters.description: A minimum image file size to search for.

parameters.name: imageHeightMax
parameters.description: A maximum image height to search for.

parameters.name: imageHeightMin
parameters.description: A minimum image height to search for.

parameters.name: imageName
parameters.description: Human readable names to search for.

parameters.name: imageTimeStampRangeEnd
parameters.description: The latest timestamp to search for.

parameters.name: imageTimeStampRangeStart
parameters.description: The earliest timestamp to search for.

parameters.name: imageWidthMax
parameters.description: A maximum image width to search for.

parameters.name: imageWidthMin
parameters.description: A minimum image width to search for.

parameters.name: mimeType
parameters.description: A set of image file types to search for.

parameters.name: observationDbId
parameters.description: A list of observation Ids this image is associated with to search for

parameters.name: imageDbId
parameters.description: A list of image Ids to search for

parameters.name: observationUnitDbId
parameters.description: A set of observation unit identifiers to search for.

parameters.name: includeObservation
parameters.description:
Use this parameter to include a list of observations embedded in each ObservationUnit object. 

CAUTION - Use this parameter at your own risk. It may return large, unpaginated lists of observation data. Only set this value to True if you are sure you need to.

parameters.description: The ID which uniquely identifies a trial to search for

parameters.description: The human readable name of a trial to search for

parameters.description:
**Deprecated in v2.1** Please use `studyDbIds`. Github issue number #483
The unique ID of a studies to filter on

parameters.name: ontologyDbId
parameters.description: List of ontology IDs to search for

parameters.name: methodDbId
parameters.description: List of methods to filter search results

parameters.name: methodName
parameters.description:
Human readable name for the method
MIAPPE V1.1 (DM-88) Method Name of the method of observation

parameters.name: methodPUI
parameters.description: The Permanent Unique Identifier of a Method, usually in the form of a URI

parameters.name: scaleDbId
parameters.description: The unique identifier for a Scale

parameters.name: scaleName
parameters.description:
Name of the scale
MIAPPE V1.1 (DM-92) Scale Name of the scale associated with the variable

parameters.name: scalePUI
parameters.description: The Permanent Unique Identifier of a Scale, usually in the form of a URI

parameters.name: dataType
parameters.description: List of scale data types to filter search results

parameters.name: traitClass
parameters.description: List of trait classes to filter search results

parameters.name: traitDbId
parameters.description: The unique identifier for a Trait

parameters.name: traitName
parameters.description:
The human readable name of a trait
MIAPPE V1.1 (DM-86) Trait - Name of the (plant or environmental) trait under observation

parameters.name: traitPUI
parameters.description: The Permanent Unique Identifier of a Trait, usually in the form of a URI

parameters.name: traitAttribute
parameters.description: A trait can be decomposed as "Trait" = "Entity" + "Attribute", the attribute is the observed feature (or characteristic) of the entity e.g., for "grain colour", attribute = "colour"

parameters.name: traitAttributePUI
parameters.description:
The Permanent Unique Identifier of a Trait Attribute, usually in the form of a URI
A trait can be decomposed as "Trait" = "Entity" + "Attribute", the attribute is the observed feature (or characteristic) of the entity e.g., for "grain colour", attribute = "colour"

parameters.name: traitEntity
parameters.description: A trait can be decomposed as "Trait" = "Entity" + "Attribute", the entity is the part of the plant that the trait refers to e.g., for "grain colour", entity = "grain"

parameters.name: traitEntityPUI
parameters.description:
The Permanent Unique Identifier of a Trait Entity, usually in the form of a URI
A trait can be decomposed as "Trait" = "Entity" + "Attribute", the entity is the part of the plant that the trait refers to e.g., for "grain colour", entity = "grain"

post.description:
Submit a search request for `Image`
Search requests allow a client to send a complex query for data. However, the server may not respond with the search results immediately. If a server needs more time to process the request, it might respond with a `searchResultsDbId`. Use the corresponding `GET /search/image/{searchResultsDbId}` to retrieve the results of the search.
Review the Search Services documentation for additional implementation details.

Submit a search request for `Observation`
Search requests allow a client to send a complex query for data. However, the server may not respond with the search results immediately. If a server needs more time to process the request, it might respond with a `searchResultsDbId`. Use the corresponding `GET /search/observation/{searchResultsDbId}` to retrieve the results of the search.
Review the Search Services documentation for additional implementation details.

Submit a search request for `ObservationUnit`
Search requests allow a client to send a complex query for data. However, the server may not respond with the search results immediately. If a server needs more time to process the request, it might respond with a `searchResultsDbId`. Use the corresponding `GET /search/observationUnit/{searchResultsDbId}` to retrieve the results of the search.
Review the Search Services documentation for additional implementation details.

Submit a search request for `ObservationVariable`
Search requests allow a client to send a complex query for data. However, the server may not respond with the search results immediately. If a server needs more time to process the request, it might respond with a `searchResultsDbId`. Use the corresponding `GET /search/observationVariable/{searchResultsDbId}` to retrieve the results of the search.
Review the Search Services documentation for additional implementation details.

get.description:
Get the results of a `Image` search request
Clients should submit a search request using the corresponding `POST /search/image` endpoint. Search requests allow a client to send a complex query for data. However, the server may not respond with the search results immediately. If a server needs more time to process the request, it might respond with a `searchResultsDbId`. Use this endpoint to retrieve the results of the search.
Review the Search Services documentation for additional implementation details.

additionalProperties.description: A free space containing any additional information related to a particular object.

AdditionalInfo.description: A free space containing any additional information related to a particular object. A data source may provide any JSON object, unrestricted by the BrAPI specification.

attributeCategory.description: General category for the attribute. very similar to Trait class.

attributeDbId.description: The ID which uniquely identifies this attribute within the given database server

attributeDescription.description: A human readable description of this attribute

attributeName.description: A human readable name for this attribute

attributePUI.description: The Permanent Unique Identifier of an Attribute, usually in the form of a URI

contextOfUse.description: Indication of how trait is routinely used. (examples: ["Trial evaluation", "Nursery evaluation"])

documentationURL.description: A URL to the human readable documentation of an object

externalReferences.description: An array of external reference ids. These are references to this piece of data in an external system. Could be a simple string or a URI.

growthStage.description: Growth stage at which measurement is made (examples: "flowering")

institution.description: Name of institution submitting the variable

language.description: 2 letter ISO 639-1 code for the language of submission of the variable.

scientist.description: Name of scientist submitting the variable.

submissionTimestamp.description: Timestamp when the Variable was added (ISO 8601)

Context.title: context
Context.description:
The JSON-LD Context is used to provide JSON-LD definitions to each field in a JSON object. By providing an array of context file urls, a BrAPI response object becomes JSON-LD compatible.  

For more information, see https://w3c.github.io/json-ld-syntax/#the-context

URL.description: The URL or URI to the documentation

type.description: The type of documentation, which can be OBO Foundry, an RDF term or a webpage.

eventDateRange.description: An object describing when a particular Event has taken place. An Event can occur at one or more discrete time points (`discreteDates`) or an event can happen continuously over a longer period of time (`startDate`, `endDate`)

eventDescription.description:
A detailed, human-readable description of this event
MIAPPE V1.1 (DM-67) Event description - Description of the event, including details such as amount applied and possibly duration of the event.

eventParameters.description: A list of objects describing additional event parameters. Each of the following accepts a human-readable value or URI

eventType.description:
An identifier for this event type, in the form of an ontology class reference
ICASA Management events allow for the following types: planting, fertilizer, irrigation, tillage, organic_material, harvest, bed_prep, inorg_mulch, inorg_mul_rem, chemicals, mowing, observation, weeding, puddling, flood_level, other
MIAPPE V1.1 (DM-66) Event accession number - Accession number of the event type in a suitable controlled vocabulary (Crop Ontology).

eventTypeDbId.description:
An identifier for this event type, in the form of an ontology class reference
ICASA Management events allow for the following types: planting, fertilizer, irrigation, tillage, organic_material, harvest, bed_prep, inorg_mulch, inorg_mul_rem, chemicals, mowing, observation, weeding, puddling, flood_level, other
MIAPPE V1.1 (DM-66) Event accession number - Accession number of the event type in a suitable controlled vocabulary (Crop Ontology).

observationUnitDbIds.description: A list of the affected observation units. If this parameter is not given, it is understood that the event affected all units in the study

Event.description:
An event is discrete occurrence at a particular time in the experiment. Events may be the realization of Treatments or parts of Treatments, or may be confounding to Treatments.
ICASA Management Events allow for the following types -> planting, fertilizer, irrigation, tillage, organic_material, harvest, bed_prep, inorg_mulch, inorg_mul_rem, chemicals, mowing, observation, weeding, puddling, flood_level, other

discreteDates.description:
A list of dates when the event occurred
MIAPPE V1.1 (DM-68) Event date - Date and time of the event.

endDate.description:
The end of a continuous or regularly repetitive event
MIAPPE V1.1 (DM-68) Event date - Date and time of the event.

startDate.description:
The beginning of a continuous or regularly repetitive event
MIAPPE V1.1 (DM-68) Event date - Date and time of the event.

EventDateRange.description: An object describing when a particular Event has taken place. An Event can occur at one or more discrete time points (`discreteDates`) or an event can happen continuously over a longer period of time (`startDate`, `endDate`)

code.description:
The shortened code name of an event parameter
ICASA "Code_Display"

description.description: A human readable description of this event parameter. This description is usually associated with the 'name' and 'code' of an event parameter.

name.description:
The full name of an event parameter
ICASA "Variable_Name"

units.description:
The units or data type of the 'value'.
If the 'value' comes from a standardized vocabulary or an encoded list of values, then 'unit' should be 'code'.
If the 'value' IS NOT a number, then 'unit' should specify a data type eg. 'text', 'boolean', 'date', etc.
If the value IS a number, then 'unit' should specify the units used eg. 'ml', 'cm', etc
ICASA "Unit_or_type"

value.description: The single value of this event parameter. This single value is accurate for all the dates in the date range. If 'value' is populated then 'valuesByDate' should NOT be populated.

valueDescription.description: If the event parameter 'unit' field is 'code', then use 'valueDescription' to add a human readable description to the value.

valuesByDate.description: An array of values corresponding to each timestamp in the 'discreteDates' array of this event. The 'valuesByDate' array should exactly match the size of the 'discreteDates' array. If 'valuesByDate' is populated then 'value' should NOT be populated.

EventParameter.description: Additional metadata to describe an event, based on the ICASA standard model. For example, 'Tillage Implement' (tiimp), 'Tillage Depth' (tidep), and 'Tillage Mix Effectiveness' (timix) might all be recorded parameters for a Tillage event.

referenceId.description: The external reference ID. Could be a simple string or a URI.

referenceSource.description: An identifier for the source system or database of this reference

GeoJSON.description:
One geometry as defined by GeoJSON (RFC 7946). All coordinates are decimal values on the WGS84 geographic coordinate reference system.

Copied from RFC 7946 Section 3.1.1

A position is an array of numbers. There MUST be two or more elements. The first two elements are longitude and latitude, or
easting and northing, precisely in that order and using decimal numbers. Altitude or elevation MAY be included as an optional third element.

oneOf.description:
Copied from RFC 7946 Section 3.1.1

A position is an array of numbers. There MUST be two or more elements. The first two elements are longitude and latitude, or
easting and northing, precisely in that order and using decimal numbers. Altitude or elevation MAY be included as an optional third element.

An array of Linear Rings. Each Linear Ring is an array of Points. 

A Point is an array of numbers. There MUST be two or more elements. The first two elements are longitude and latitude, or
easting and northing, precisely in that order and using decimal numbers. Altitude or elevation MAY be included as an optional third element.

imageDbId.description: The unique identifier of an image

allOf.description: The metadata for an image file that is connected to some phenotypic observation data.

copyright.description: The copyright information of this image. Example 'Copyright 2018 Bob Robertson'

description.description: The human readable description of an image.

descriptiveOntologyTerms.description: A list of terms to formally describe the image. Each item could be a simple Tag, an Ontology reference Id, or a full ontology URL.

externalReferences.description: An array of external reference ids. These are references to this piece of data in an external system. Could be a simple string or a URI.

imageFileName.description: The name of the image file. Might be the same as 'imageName', but could be different.

imageFileSize.description: The size of the image in Bytes.

imageHeight.description: The height of the image in Pixels.

imageName.description: The human readable name of an image. Might be the same as 'imageFileName', but could be different.

imageTimeStamp.description: The date and time the image was taken

imageURL.description: The complete, absolute URI path to the image file. Images might be stored on a different host or path than the BrAPI web server.

imageWidth.description: The width of the image in Pixels.

mimeType.description: The file type of the image. Examples 'image/jpeg', 'image/png', 'image/svg', etc

observationDbIds.description: A list of observation Ids this image is associated with, if applicable.

ImageNewRequest.description: The metadata for an image file that is connected to some phenotypic observation data.

commonCropNames.description:
The BrAPI Common Crop Name is the simple, generalized, widely accepted name of the organism being researched. It is most often used in multi-crop systems where digital resources need to be divided at a high level. Things like 'Maize', 'Wheat', and 'Rice' are examples of common crop names.

Use this parameter to only return results associated with the given crops. 

Use `GET /commoncropnames` to find the list of available crops on a server.

descriptiveOntologyTerms.description: A list of terms to formally describe the image to search for. Each item could be a simple Tag, an Ontology reference Id, or a full ontology URL.

imageDbIds.description: A list of image Ids to search for

imageFileNames.description: Image file names to search for.

imageFileSizeMax.description: A maximum image file size to search for.

imageFileSizeMin.description: A minimum image file size to search for.

imageHeightMax.description: A maximum image height to search for.

imageHeightMin.description: A minimum image height to search for.

imageNames.description: Human readable names to search for.

imageTimeStampRangeEnd.description: The latest timestamp to search for.

imageTimeStampRangeStart.description: The earliest timestamp to search for.

imageWidthMax.description: A maximum image width to search for.

imageWidthMin.description: A minimum image width to search for.

mimeTypes.description: A set of image file types to search for.

observationDbIds.description: A list of observation Ids this image is associated with to search for

observationUnitDbIds.description: A set of observation unit identifiers to search for.

programDbIds.description:
A BrAPI Program represents the high level organization or group who is responsible for conducting trials and studies. Things like Breeding Programs and Funded Projects are considered BrAPI Programs. 

Use this parameter to only return results associated with the given programs. 

Use `GET /programs` to find the list of available programs on a server.

programNames.description:
Use this parameter to only return results associated with the given program names. Program names are not required to be unique.

Use `GET /programs` to find the list of available programs on a server.

ImageSearchRequest.description: The metadata for an image file that is connected to some phenotypic observation data.

allOf.description:
A description of the way an Observation should be collected.
For example, an ObservationVariable might be defined with a Trait of "plant height", a Scale of "meters", and a Method of "tape measure". This variable would be distinct from a variable with the Method "estimation" or "drone image processing".

bibliographicalReference.description:
Bibliographical reference describing the method.
MIAPPE V1.1 (DM-91) Reference associated to the method - URI/DOI of reference describing the method.

description.description:
Method description
MIAPPE V1.1 (DM-90) Method description - Textual description of the method, which may extend a method defined in an external reference with specific parameters, e.g. growth stage, inoculation precise organ (leaf number)

externalReferences.description: An array of external reference ids. These are references to this piece of data in an external system. Could be a simple string or a URI.

formula.description: For computational methods i.e., when the method consists in assessing the trait by computing measurements, write the generic formula used for the calculation

methodName.description:
Human readable name for the method
MIAPPE V1.1 (DM-88) Method Name of the method of observation

methodPUI.description: The Permanent Unique Identifier of a Method, usually in the form of a URI

MethodNewRequest.description:
A description of the way an Observation should be collected.
For example, an ObservationVariable might be defined with a Trait of "plant height", a Scale of "meters", and a Method of "tape measure". This variable would be distinct from a variable with the Method "estimation" or "drone image processing".

observationDbId.description: The ID which uniquely identifies an observation

allOf.description: A value assigned for a specific ObservationVariable when observing a specific ObservationUnit.

collector.description: The name or identifier of the entity which collected the observation

externalReferences.description: An array of external reference ids. These are references to this piece of data in an external system. Could be a simple string or a URI.

observationTimeStamp.description: The date and time when this observation was made

uploadedBy.description: The name or id of the user who uploaded the observation to the database system

value.description: The value of the data collected as an observation

ObservationNewRequest.description: A value assigned for a specific ObservationVariable when observing a specific ObservationUnit.

commonCropNames.description:
The BrAPI Common Crop Name is the simple, generalized, widely accepted name of the organism being researched. It is most often used in multi-crop systems where digital resources need to be divided at a high level. Things like 'Maize', 'Wheat', and 'Rice' are examples of common crop names.

Use this parameter to only return results associated with the given crops. 

Use `GET /commoncropnames` to find the list of available crops on a server.

germplasmNames.description: List of human readable names to identify germplasm to search for

locationDbIds.description: The location ids to search for

locationNames.description: A human readable names to search for

observationDbIds.description: The unique id of an Observation

observationUnitDbIds.description: The unique id of an Observation Unit

observationVariableDbIds.description: The DbIds of Variables to search for

observationVariableNames.description: The names of Variables to search for

observationVariablePUIs.description: The Permanent Unique Identifier of an Observation Variable, usually in the form of a URI

programDbIds.description:
A BrAPI Program represents the high level organization or group who is responsible for conducting trials and studies. Things like Breeding Programs and Funded Projects are considered BrAPI Programs. 

Use this parameter to only return results associated with the given programs. 

Use `GET /programs` to find the list of available programs on a server.

programNames.description:
Use this parameter to only return results associated with the given program names. Program names are not required to be unique.

Use `GET /programs` to find the list of available programs on a server.

seasonDbIds.description: The year or Phenotyping campaign of a multi-annual study (trees, grape, ...)

studyDbIds.description: List of study identifiers to search for

studyNames.description: List of study names to filter search results

trialDbIds.description: The ID which uniquely identifies a trial to search for

trialNames.description: The human readable name of a trial to search for

ObservationSearchRequest.description: A value assigned for a specific ObservationVariable when observing a specific ObservationUnit.

factor.description:
The type of treatment/factor. ex. 'fertilizer', 'inoculation', 'irrigation', etc

MIAPPE V1.1 (DM-61) Experimental Factor type - Name/Acronym of the experimental factor.

modality.description:
The treatment/factor description. ex. 'low fertilizer', 'yellow rust inoculation', 'high water', etc

MIAPPE V1.1 (DM-62) Experimental Factor description - Free text description of the experimental factor. This includes all relevant treatments planned and protocol planned for all the plants targeted by a given experimental factor.

ObservationTreatment.description: A Treatment applied an Observation Unit at a given Modality/Level for a specific Factor.

observationUnitDbId.description:
The ID which uniquely identifies an observation unit

MIAPPE V1.1 (DM-70) Observation unit ID - Identifier used to identify the observation unit in data files containing the values observed or measured on that unit. Must be locally unique.

allOf.description: A representation of the physical entity being observed during a phenotype data collection process. Typically, this is a Plot or a Plant, but it could include things like Fields, Blocks, or Samples.

levelName.description: A name for this level **Standard Level Names: study, field, entry, rep, block, sub-block, plot, sub-plot, plant, pot, sample** For more information on Observation Levels, please review the Observation Levels documentation.

levelOrder.description: `levelOrder` defines where that level exists in the hierarchy of levels. `levelOrder`'s lower numbers are at the top of the hierarchy (ie field -> 1) and higher numbers are at the bottom of the hierarchy (ie plant -> 9). For more information on Observation Levels, please review the Observation Levels documentation.

ObservationUnitHierarchyLevel.description: The exact level and level code of an observation unit. For more information on Observation Levels, please review the Observation Levels documentation. MIAPPE V1.1 DM-71 Observation unit type "Type of observation unit in textual form, usually one of the following: study, block, sub-block, plot, sub-plot, pot, plant. Use of other observation unit types is possible but not recommended. The observation unit type can not be used to indicate sub-plant levels. However, observations can still be made on the sub-plant level, as long as the details are indicated in the associated observed variable (see observed variables). Alternatively, it is possible to use samples for more detailed tracing of sub-plant units, attaching the observations to them instead."

levelCode.description:
An ID code or number to represent a real thing that may or may not be an an observation unit.
For example, if the 'levelName' is 'plot', then the 'levelCode' would be the plot number or plot barcode. If this plot is also considered an ObservationUnit, then the appropriate observationUnitDbId should also be recorded.
If the 'levelName' is 'field', then the 'levelCode' might be something like '3' or 'F3' to indicate the third field at a research station.

levelName.description: A name for this level **Standard Level Names: study, field, entry, rep, block, sub-block, plot, sub-plot, plant, pot, sample** For more information on Observation Levels, please review the Observation Levels documentation.

levelOrder.description: `levelOrder` defines where that level exists in the hierarchy of levels. `levelOrder`'s lower numbers are at the top of the hierarchy (ie field -> 1) and higher numbers are at the bottom of the hierarchy (ie plant -> 9). For more information on Observation Levels, please review the Observation Levels documentation.

ObservationUnitLevel.description: The exact level and level code of an observation unit. For more information on Observation Levels, please review the Observation Levels documentation. MIAPPE V1.1 DM-71 Observation unit type "Type of observation unit in textual form, usually one of the following: study, block, sub-block, plot, sub-plot, pot, plant. Use of other observation unit types is possible but not recommended. The observation unit type can not be used to indicate sub-plant levels. However, observations can still be made on the sub-plant level, as long as the details are indicated in the associated observed variable (see observed variables). Alternatively, it is possible to use samples for more detailed tracing of sub-plant units, attaching the observations to them instead."

levelCode.description:
An ID code or number to represent a real thing that may or may not be an an observation unit.
For example, if the 'levelName' is 'plot', then the 'levelCode' would be the plot number or plot barcode. If this plot is also considered an ObservationUnit, then the appropriate observationUnitDbId should also be recorded.
If the 'levelName' is 'field', then the 'levelCode' might be something like '3' or 'F3' to indicate the third field at a research station.

levelName.description: A name for this level **Standard Level Names: study, field, entry, rep, block, sub-block, plot, sub-plot, plant, pot, sample** For more information on Observation Levels, please review the Observation Levels documentation.

levelOrder.description: `levelOrder` defines where that level exists in the hierarchy of levels. `levelOrder`'s lower numbers are at the top of the hierarchy (ie field -> 1) and higher numbers are at the bottom of the hierarchy (ie plant -> 9). For more information on Observation Levels, please review the Observation Levels documentation.

ObservationUnitLevelRelationship.description: Observation levels indicate the granularity level at which the measurements are taken. `levelName` defines the level, `levelOrder` defines where that level exists in the hierarchy of levels. `levelOrder`s lower numbers are at the top of the hierarchy (ie field > 0) and higher numbers are at the bottom of the hierarchy (ie plant > 6). `levelCode` is an ID code for this level tag. Identify this observation unit by each level of the hierarchy where it exists. For more information on Observation Levels, please review the Observation Levels documentation. **Standard Level Names: study, field, entry, rep, block, sub-block, plot, sub-plot, plant, pot, sample**

externalReferences.description: An array of external reference ids. These are references to this piece of data in an external system. Could be a simple string or a URI.

observationUnitName.description: A human readable name for an observation unit

observationUnitPUI.description:
A Permanent Unique Identifier for an observation unit

MIAPPE V1.1 (DM-72) External ID - Identifier for the observation unit in a persistent repository, comprises the name of the repository and the identifier of the observation unit therein. The EBI Biosamples repository can be used. URI are recommended when possible.

observationUnitPosition.description:
All positional and layout information related to this Observation Unit 

MIAPPE V1.1 (DM-73) Spatial distribution - Type and value of a spatial coordinate (georeference or relative) 
or level of observation (plot 45, subblock 7, block 2) provided as a key-value pair of the form type:value. 
Levels of observation must be consistent with those listed in the Study section.

treatments.description:
List of treatments applied to an observation unit.

MIAPPE V1.1 (DM-74) Observation Unit factor value - List of values for each factor applied to the observation unit.

ObservationUnitNewRequest.description: A representation of the physical entity being observed during a phenotype data collection process. Typically, this is a Plot or a Plant, but it could include things like Fields, Blocks, or Samples.

entryType.description: The type of entry for this observation unit. ex. "CHECK", "TEST", "FILLER"

geoCoordinates.description:
One geometry as defined by GeoJSON (RFC 7946). All coordinates are decimal values on the WGS84 geographic coordinate reference system.

Copied from RFC 7946 Section 3.1.1

A position is an array of numbers. There MUST be two or more elements. The first two elements are longitude and latitude, or
easting and northing, precisely in that order and using decimal numbers. Altitude or elevation MAY be included as an optional third element.

observationLevelRelationships.description: Observation levels indicate the granularity level at which the measurements are taken. `levelName` defines the level, `levelOrder` defines where that level exists in the hierarchy of levels. `levelOrder`s lower numbers are at the top of the hierarchy (ie field > 0) and higher numbers are at the bottom of the hierarchy (ie plant > 6). `levelCode` is an ID code for this level tag. Identify this observation unit by each level of the hierarchy where it exists. For more information on Observation Levels, please review the Observation Levels documentation. **Standard Level Names: study, field, entry, rep, block, sub-block, plot, sub-plot, plant, pot, sample**

positionCoordinateX.description: The X position coordinate for an observation unit. Different systems may use different coordinate systems.

positionCoordinateY.description: The Y position coordinate for an observation unit. Different systems may use different coordinate systems.

ObservationUnitPosition.description: All positional and layout information related to this Observation Unit

commonCropNames.description:
The BrAPI Common Crop Name is the simple, generalized, widely accepted name of the organism being researched. It is most often used in multi-crop systems where digital resources need to be divided at a high level. Things like 'Maize', 'Wheat', and 'Rice' are examples of common crop names.

Use this parameter to only return results associated with the given crops. 

Use `GET /commoncropnames` to find the list of available crops on a server.

includeObservations.description:
Use this parameter to include a list of observations embedded in each ObservationUnit object. 

CAUTION - Use this parameter at your own risk. It may return large, unpaginated lists of observation data. Only set this value to True if you are sure you need to.

ObservationUnitSearchRequest.description: A representation of the physical entity being observed during a phenotype data collection process. Typically, this is a Plot or a Plant, but it could include things like Fields, Blocks, or Samples.

observationVariableDbId.description:
Variable unique identifier

MIAPPE V1.1 (DM-83) Variable ID - Code used to identify the variable in the data file. We recommend using a variable definition from the Crop Ontology where possible. Otherwise, the Crop Ontology naming convention is recommended: <trait abbreviation>_<method abbreviation>_<scale abbreviation>). A variable ID must be unique within a given investigation.

contextOfUse.description: Indication of how trait is routinely used. (examples: ["Trial evaluation", "Nursery evaluation"])

documentationURL.description: A URL to the human readable documentation of an object

externalReferences.description: An array of external reference ids. These are references to this piece of data in an external system. Could be a simple string or a URI.

growthStage.description: Growth stage at which measurement is made (examples: "flowering")

institution.description: Name of institution submitting the variable

language.description: 2 letter ISO 639-1 code for the language of submission of the variable.

observationVariableName.description:
Variable name (usually a short name)

MIAPPE V1.1 (DM-84) Variable name - Name of the variable.

observationVariablePUI.description: The Permanent Unique Identifier of a Observation Variable, usually in the form of a URI

scientist.description: Name of scientist submitting the variable.

submissionTimestamp.description: Timestamp when the Variable was added (ISO 8601)

commonCropNames.description:
The BrAPI Common Crop Name is the simple, generalized, widely accepted name of the organism being researched. It is most often used in multi-crop systems where digital resources need to be divided at a high level. Things like 'Maize', 'Wheat', and 'Rice' are examples of common crop names.

Use this parameter to only return results associated with the given crops. 

Use `GET /commoncropnames` to find the list of available crops on a server.

dataTypes.description: List of scale data types to filter search results

methodDbIds.description: List of methods to filter search results

Human readable name for the method
MIAPPE V1.1 (DM-88) Method Name of the method of observation

methodPUIs.description: The Permanent Unique Identifier of a Method, usually in the form of a URI

observationVariableDbIds.description: The DbIds of Variables to search for

observationVariableNames.description: The names of Variables to search for

observationVariablePUIs.description: The Permanent Unique Identifier of an Observation Variable, usually in the form of a URI

ontologyDbIds.description: List of ontology IDs to search for

A BrAPI Program represents the high level organization or group who is responsible for conducting trials and studies. Things like Breeding Programs and Funded Projects are considered BrAPI Programs. 

Use this parameter to only return results associated with the given programs. 

Use `GET /programs` to find the list of available programs on a server.

programNames.description:
Use this parameter to only return results associated with the given program names. Program names are not required to be unique.

Use `GET /programs` to find the list of available programs on a server.

scaleDbIds.description: The unique identifier for a Scale

scaleNames.description:
Name of the scale
MIAPPE V1.1 (DM-92) Scale Name of the scale associated with the variable

scalePUIs.description: The Permanent Unique Identifier of a Scale, usually in the form of a URI

studyDbId.description:
**Deprecated in v2.1** Please use `studyDbIds`. Github issue number #483
The unique ID of a studies to filter on

studyDbIds.description: List of study identifiers to search for

studyNames.description: List of study names to filter search results

traitAttributePUIs.description:
The Permanent Unique Identifier of a Trait Attribute, usually in the form of a URI
A trait can be decomposed as "Trait" = "Entity" + "Attribute", the attribute is the observed feature (or characteristic) of the entity e.g., for "grain colour", attribute = "colour"

traitAttributes.description: A trait can be decomposed as "Trait" = "Entity" + "Attribute", the attribute is the observed feature (or characteristic) of the entity e.g., for "grain colour", attribute = "colour"

traitClasses.description: List of trait classes to filter search results

traitDbIds.description: The unique identifier for a Trait

traitEntities.description: A trait can be decomposed as "Trait" = "Entity" + "Attribute", the entity is the part of the plant that the trait refers to e.g., for "grain colour", entity = "grain"

traitEntityPUIs.description:
The Permanent Unique Identifier of a Trait Entity, usually in the form of a URI
A trait can be decomposed as "Trait" = "Entity" + "Attribute", the entity is the part of the plant that the trait refers to e.g., for "grain colour", entity = "grain"

traitNames.description:
The human readable name of a trait
MIAPPE V1.1 (DM-86) Trait - Name of the (plant or environmental) trait under observation

traitPUIs.description: The Permanent Unique Identifier of a Trait, usually in the form of a URI

trialDbIds.description: The ID which uniquely identifies a trial to search for

trialNames.description: The human readable name of a trial to search for

allOf.description: The identifier and metadata needed to reference an external controlled vocabulary

authors.description: Ontology's list of authors (no specific format)

documentationURL.description: A URL to the human readable documentation of an object

OntologyNewRequest.description: The identifier and metadata needed to reference an external controlled vocabulary

ontologyReferenceDbId.description: The ID which uniquely identifies a ontology reference

OntologyReference.description:
MIAPPE V1.1 (DM-85) Variable accession number - Accession number of the variable in the Crop Ontology 
MIAPPE V1.1 (DM-87) Trait accession number - Accession number of the trait in a suitable controlled vocabulary (Crop Ontology, Trait Ontology).
MIAPPE V1.1 (DM-89) Method accession number - Accession number of the method in a suitable controlled vocabulary (Crop Ontology, Trait Ontology).
MIAPPE V1.1 (DM-93) Scale accession number - Accession number of the scale in a suitable controlled vocabulary (Crop Ontology).

term.description: Ontology term - the label of the ontology term the termId is pointing to.

termURI.description: Ontology term identifier - the CURIE for an ontology term. It differs from the standard GA4GH schema's :ref:`id ` in that it is a CURIE pointing to an information resource outside of the scope of the schema or its resource implementation.

OntologyTerm.description: A pointer to an ontology used by a genomic reference

PositionCoordinateType.description:
The type of positional coordinate. Must be one of the following values 

LONGITUDE - ISO 6709 standard, WGS84 geodetic datum. See 'Location Coordinate Encoding' for details 

LATITUDE - ISO 6709 standard, WGS84 geodetic datum. See 'Location Coordinate Encoding' for details 

PLANTED_ROW - The physical planted row number 

PLANTED_INDIVIDUAL - The physical counted number, could be independent or within a planted row 

GRID_ROW - The row index number of a square grid overlay 

GRID_COL - The column index number of a square grid overlay 

MEASURED_ROW - The distance in meters from a defined 0-th row 

MEASURED_COL - The distance in meters from a defined 0-th column

scaleDbId.description: Unique identifier of the scale. If left blank, the upload system will automatically generate a scale ID.

allOf.description:
A Scale describes the units and acceptable values for an ObservationVariable.
For example, an ObservationVariable might be defined with a Trait of "plant height", a Scale of "meters", and a Method of "tape measure". This variable would be distinct from a variable with the Scale "inches" or "pixels".

dataType.description:
Class of the scale, entries can be

"Code" - This scale class is exceptionally used to express complex traits. Code is a nominal scale that combines the expressions of the different traits composing the complex trait. For example a severity trait might be expressed by a 2 digit and 2 character code. The first 2 digits are the percentage of the plant covered by a fungus and the 2 characters refer to the delay in development, e.g. "75VD" means "75 %" of the plant is infected and the plant is very delayed.

"Date" - The date class is for events expressed in a time format, See ISO 8601

"Duration" - The Duration class is for time elapsed between two events expressed in a time format, e.g. days, hours, months

"Nominal" - Categorical scale that can take one of a limited and fixed number of categories. There is no intrinsic ordering to the categories

"Numerical" - Numerical scales express the trait with real numbers. The numerical scale defines the unit e.g. centimeter, ton per hectare, branches

"Ordinal" - Ordinal scales are scales composed of ordered categories

"Text" - A free text is used to express the trait.

decimalPlaces.description: For numerical, number of decimal places to be reported

externalReferences.description: An array of external reference ids. These are references to this piece of data in an external system. Could be a simple string or a URI.

scaleName.description:
Name of the scale
MIAPPE V1.1 (DM-92) Scale Name of the scale associated with the variable

scalePUI.description: The Permanent Unique Identifier of a Scale, usually in the form of a URI

units.description:
This field can be used to describe the units used for this scale. This should be the abbreviated 
form of the units, intended to be displayed with every value using this scale. Usually this only 
applies when `dataType` is Numeric, but could also be included for other dataTypes when applicable.

ScaleNewRequest.description:
A Scale describes the units and acceptable values for an ObservationVariable.
For example, an ObservationVariable might be defined with a Trait of "plant height", a Scale of "meters", and a Method of "tape measure". This variable would be distinct from a variable with the Scale "inches" or "pixels".

traitDbId.description: The ID which uniquely identifies a trait

allOf.description:
A Trait describes what property is being observed.
For example, an ObservationVariable might be defined with a Trait of "plant height", a Scale of "meters", and a Method of "tape measure". This variable would be distinct from a variable with the Trait "Leaf length" or "Flower height".

TraitDataType.description:
Class of the scale, entries can be

"Code" - This scale class is exceptionally used to express complex traits. Code is a nominal scale that combines the expressions of the different traits composing the complex trait. For example a severity trait might be expressed by a 2 digit and 2 character code. The first 2 digits are the percentage of the plant covered by a fungus and the 2 characters refer to the delay in development, e.g. "75VD" means "75 %" of the plant is infected and the plant is very delayed.

"Date" - The date class is for events expressed in a time format, See ISO 8601

"Duration" - The Duration class is for time elapsed between two events expressed in a time format, e.g. days, hours, months

"Nominal" - Categorical scale that can take one of a limited and fixed number of categories. There is no intrinsic ordering to the categories

"Numerical" - Numerical scales express the trait with real numbers. The numerical scale defines the unit e.g. centimeter, ton per hectare, branches

"Ordinal" - Ordinal scales are scales composed of ordered categories

"Text" - A free text is used to express the trait.

alternativeAbbreviations.description: A list of shortened, human readable, names for a Trait. These abbreviations are acceptable alternatives to the mainAbbreviation and do not need to follow any formatting convention.

attribute.description: A trait can be decomposed as "Trait" = "Entity" + "Attribute", the attribute is the observed feature (or characteristic) of the entity e.g., for "grain colour", attribute = "colour"

attributePUI.description:
The Permanent Unique Identifier of a Trait Attribute, usually in the form of a URI
A trait can be decomposed as "Trait" = "Entity" + "Attribute", the attribute is the observed feature (or characteristic) of the entity e.g., for "grain colour", attribute = "colour"

entity.description: A trait can be decomposed as "Trait" = "Entity" + "Attribute", the entity is the part of the plant that the trait refers to e.g., for "grain colour", entity = "grain"

entityPUI.description:
The Permanent Unique Identifier of a Trait Entity, usually in the form of a URI
A Trait can be decomposed as "Trait" = "Entity" + "Attribute", the Entity is the part of the plant that the trait refers to e.g., for "grain colour", entity = "grain"

externalReferences.description: An array of external reference ids. These are references to this piece of data in an external system. Could be a simple string or a URI.

mainAbbreviation.description: A shortened version of the human readable name for a Trait

traitClass.description:
A classification to describe the type of trait and the context it should be considered in.
examples- "morphological", "phenological", "agronomical", "physiological", "abiotic stress", "biotic stress", "biochemical", "quality traits", "fertility", etc.

traitName.description:
The human readable name of a trait
MIAPPE V1.1 (DM-86) Trait - Name of the (plant or environmental) trait under observation

traitPUI.description: The Permanent Unique Identifier of a Trait, usually in the form of a URI

TraitNewRequest.description:
A Trait describes what property is being observed.
For example, an ObservationVariable might be defined with a Trait of "plant height", a Scale of "meters", and a Method of "tape measure". This variable would be distinct from a variable with the Trait "Leaf length" or "Flower height".

categories.description: List of possible values with optional labels

maximumValue.description: Maximum value for numerical, date, and time scales. Typically used for data capture control and QC.

minimumValue.description: Minimum value for numerical, date, and time scales. Typically used for data capture control and QC.

ValidValues.description: Metadata describing the acceptable values for this Scale

label.description: A text label for a category

value.description: The actual value for a category

ValidValuesCategory.description: If the Scale is a categorical type, these objects define the valid options

contextOfUse.description: Indication of how trait is routinely used. (examples: ["Trial evaluation", "Nursery evaluation"])

documentationURL.description: A URL to the human readable documentation of an object

externalReferences.description: An array of external reference ids. These are references to this piece of data in an external system. Could be a simple string or a URI.

growthStage.description: Growth stage at which measurement is made (examples: "flowering")

institution.description: Name of institution submitting the variable

language.description: 2 letter ISO 639-1 code for the language of submission of the variable.

scientist.description: Name of scientist submitting the variable.

submissionTimestamp.description: Timestamp when the Variable was added (ISO 8601)

Variable.description: A unique combination of Trait, Method, and Scale to define a clear context for an Observation.

currentPage.description: The index number for the returned page of data. This should always match the requested page number or the default page (0).

pageSize.description: The number of data elements returned, aka the size of the current page. If the requested page does not have enough elements to fill a page at the requested page size, this field should indicate the actual number of elements returned.

totalCount.description: The total number of elements that are available on the server and match the requested query parameters.

totalPages.description:
The total number of pages of elements available on the server. This should be calculated with the following formula.
totalPages = CEILING( totalCount / requested_page_size)

basePagination.description:
The pagination object is applicable only when the payload contains a "data" key. It describes the pagination of the data contained in the "data" array, as a way to identify which subset of data is being returned.
Pages are zero indexed, so the first page will be page 0 (zero).

fileURL.description: The absolute URL where the file is located

fileSize.description: The size of the file in bytes

fileDescription.description: A human readable description of the file contents
fileDescription.example: This is an Excel data file

fileType.description: The type or format of the file. Preferably MIME Type.

fileMD5Hash.description: The MD5 Hash of the file contents to be used as a check sum

dataFile.description: A dataFile contains a URL and the relevant file metadata to represent a file

datafiles.description:
The datafiles contains a list of file URLs and metadata. 
These files contain additional information related to the returned object and can be retrieved by a subsequent call. 
This could be a supplementary data file, an informational file, the uploaded file where the data originated from, a generated file representing the whole dataset in a particular format, or any other related file.

status.description:
The status field contains a list of informational status messages from the server. 
If no status is reported, an empty list should be returned. See Error Reporting for more information.

metadataBase.description: An object in the BrAPI standard response model that describes some information about the service call being performed. This includes supplementary data, status log messages, and pagination information.

message.description: A short message concerning the status of this request/response

messageType.description: The logging level for the attached message

status.description: An array of status messages to convey technical logging information from the server to the client.

nextPageToken.description:
**Deprecated in v2.1** Please use `page`. Github issue number #451
The string token used to query the next page of data.

currentPageToken.description:
**Deprecated in v2.1** Please use `page`. Github issue number #451
The string token used to query the current page of data.

prevPageToken.description:
**Deprecated in v2.1** Please use `page`. Github issue number #451
The string token used to query the previous page of data.

allOf.description:
**Deprecated in v2.1** Please use `page`. Github issue number #451
The pagination object is applicable only when the payload contains a "data" key. It describes the pagination of the data contained in the "data" array, as a way to identify which subset of data is being returned.
Tokenized pages are for large data sets which can not be efficiently broken into indexed pages. Use the nextPageToken and prevPageToken to construct an additional query and move to the next or previous page respectively.

application/json.example: ERROR - 2018-10-08T18:15:11Z - User does not have permission to perform this action

ERROR - 2018-10-08T18:15:11Z - Malformed JSON Request Object

ERROR - 2018-10-08T18:15:11Z - Invalid query parameter

ERROR - 2018-10-08T18:15:11Z - Required parameter is missing
ERROR - 2018-10-08T18:15:11Z - Missing or expired authorization token
ERROR - 2018-10-08T18:15:11Z - The requested object DbId is not found

externalReferenceID.name: externalReferenceID
externalReferenceID.description:
**Deprecated in v2.1** Please use `externalReferenceId`. Github issue number #460
An external reference ID. Could be a simple string or a URI. (use with `externalReferenceSource` parameter)

externalReferenceId.name: externalReferenceId
externalReferenceId.description: An external reference ID. Could be a simple string or a URI. (use with `externalReferenceSource` parameter)

externalReferenceSource.name: externalReferenceSource
externalReferenceSource.description: An identifier for the source system or database of an external reference (use with `externalReferenceId` parameter)

acceptHeader.name: Accept
acceptHeader.description: A standard HTTP request header that is used to request a specific content type (JSON, CSV, etc) which is "acceptable" to the client and should be returned by the server

searchResultsDbId.name: searchResultsDbId
searchResultsDbId.description: Unique identifier which references the search results

pageSize.name: pageSize
pageSize.description: The size of the pages to be returned. Default is `1000`.

authorizationHeader.name: Authorization
authorizationHeader.description: HTTP HEADER - Token used for Authorization Bearer {token_string}

page.name: page
page.description:
Used to request a specific page of data to be returned.

The page indexing starts at 0 (the first page is 'page'= 0). Default is `0`.

pageToken.name: pageToken
pageToken.description:
**Deprecated in v2.1** Please use `page`. Github issue number #451
Used to request a specific page of data to be returned.
Tokenized pages are for large data sets which can not be efficiently broken into indexed pages. Use the nextPageToken and prevPageToken from a prior response to construct a query and move to the next or previous page respectively.

AuthorizationToken.description: OAuth Bearer Token - A valid Bearer token to prove authorization
